* Represents a "Deadline" task, which includes a description and a due date/time.
* Extends the {@link Task} class and provides specific behavior for marking, unmarking,
* The date and time by which the task is due.
* Constructs a new Deadline task with the specified user input.
* Extracts the description and due date from the input string.
* @param userInput The user's input containing the description and due date (formatted as "description /by dueDate").
* Constructs a new Deadline task as a copy of an existing task, with a specified due date.
* @param date The due date of the deadline task, as a string.
* Constructs a new Deadline task as a copy of an existing task, with a specified due date.
* @param date The due date of the deadline task, as a {@link LocalDateTime} object.
* Constructs a new Deadline task with a specified completion status, description, and due date.
* @param check The completion status of the task ("[ ]" or "[X]").
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param date The due date of the deadline task, as a string.
Deadline(String check, String description, String date) {
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task, including its type, status, description, and due date.
* @return A string in the format "[D][X] Task description (by: dueDate)".
* Marks the deadline task as completed and returns a new Deadline instance with the updated status.
* @return A new deadline task marked as completed.
* Unmarks the deadline task as incomplete and returns a new Deadline instance with the updated status.
* @return A new deadline task marked as incomplete.
* Serializes the deadline task into a string format for storage or transmission.
* @return A serialized string representing the deadline task.
* Represents an "Event" task, which includes a description, a start date/time, and an end date/time.
* Extends the {@link Task} class and provides specific behavior for marking, unmarking,
* The start date and time of the event.
* The end date and time of the event.
* Constructs a new Event task with the specified user input.
* Extracts the description, start date, and end date from the input string.
* @param userInput The user's input containing the description, start date, and end date
* Constructs a new Event task as a copy of an existing task, with specified start and end dates.
* @param startDate The start date of the event, as a string.
* @param endDate The end date of the event, as a string.
Event(Task other, String startDate, String endDate) {
* Constructs a new Event task as a copy of an existing task, with specified start and end dates.
* @param startDate The start date of the event, as a {@link LocalDateTime} object.
* @param endDate The end date of the event, as a {@link LocalDateTime} object.
Event(Task other, LocalDateTime startDate, LocalDateTime endDate) {
* Constructs a new Event task with a specified completion status, description, start date, and end date.
* @param check The completion status of the task ("[ ]" or "[X]").
* @param description The description of the event task.
* @param startDate The start date of the event, as a string.
* @param endDate The end date of the event, as a string.
Event(String check, String description, String startDate, String endDate) {
* Constructs a new Event task with a specified completion status, description, start date, and end date.
* @param check The completion status of the task ("[ ]" or "[X]").
* @param description The description of the event task.
* @param startDate The start date of the event, as a {@link LocalDateTime} object.
* @param endDate The end date of the event, as a {@link LocalDateTime} object.
public Event(String check, String description, LocalDateTime startDate, LocalDateTime endDate) {
* Returns a string representation of the event task, including its type, status, description,
* @return A string in the format "[E][status] Task description (from: startDate to: endDate)".
* Marks the event task as completed and returns a new Event instance with the updated status.
* @return A new event task marked as completed.
* Unmarks the event task as incomplete and returns a new Event instance with the updated status.
* @return A new event task marked as incomplete.
* Serializes the event task into a string format for storage or transmission.
* @return A serialized string representing the event task.
* Represents a task with a description and completion status.
* Provides methods to mark the task as completed, unmark it, and serialize its state.
* This class is used as the base for more specific task types.
* The completion status of the task.
* Can be "[ ]" for incomplete or "[X]" for completed.
* Constructs a new task with the specified description.
* The task is initially marked as incomplete.
* @param userInput The description of the task.
* Constructs a new task with the specified completion status and description.
* @param check The completion status of the task ("[ ]" or "[X]").
* @param description The description of the task.
* Constructs a new task as a copy of an existing task.
* Returns a string representation of the task, including its status and description.
* @return A string in the format "[ ] Task description" or "[X] Task description".
* Marks the task as completed and returns a new Task instance with the updated status.
* @return A new task marked as completed.
* Unmarks the task as incomplete and returns a new Task instance with the updated status.
* @return A new task marked as incomplete.
* Serializes the task into a string format for storage or transmission.
* @return A serialized string representing the task.
* Represents a "Todo" task, a specific type of task with no additional attributes.
* Extends the {@link Task} class and provides specific behavior for marking, unmarking,
* Constructs a new Todo task with the specified description.
* The task is initially marked as incomplete.
* @param userInput The description of the todo task.
* Constructs a new Todo task as a copy of an existing task.
* Constructs a new Todo task with the specified completion status and description.
* @param check The completion status of the task ("[ ]" or "[X]").
* @param description The description of the todo task.
* Returns a string representation of the todo task, including its type,
* @return A string in the format "[T][X] Task description".
* Marks the todo task as completed and returns a new Todo instance with the updated status.
* @return A new todo task marked as completed.
* Unmarks the todo task as incomplete and returns a new Todo instance with the updated status.
* @return A new todo task marked as incomplete.
* Serializes the todo task into a string format for storage or transmission.
* @return A serialized string representing the todo task.

String sayDelete = "Say delete 1 to delete task 1 in the list";

' + sayDeadlines + '
' + sayEvent + '

* Represents the file system that handles the reading, writing, and serialization of task data.
* It provides methods to load tasks from a file, save tasks to a file, and serialize/deserialize
* The file path where tasks are stored.
* The list of tasks managed by the file system.
* Constructs a new FileSystem with an empty list of tasks.
* Constructs a new FileSystem with the specified list of tasks.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to initialize the file system with.
* Retrieves the list of tasks from the file. If the file exists, it deserializes the tasks
* and returns them as an ArrayList. If the file does not exist, it returns an empty list.
* @return The list of tasks read from the file, or an empty list if the file doesn't exist.
* Saves the current tasks to the file. It first ensures the directory exists, then writes
* the serialized tasks to the specified file.
* Serializes the list of tasks into a string format suitable for storage.
* Each task is serialized on a new line.
* @return A string representing all tasks, serialized for storage.
* Deserializes a string representing a task into a Task object. The string is split into
* components based on the "||" separator and the appropriate task type is created.
* @param line The serialized string representing a task.
* @return The corresponding Task object, or null if the task type is unrecognized.
* @throws FileCorruptedException If the task type in the serialized string is invalid or corrupted.

* Represents a list of tasks and provides methods for adding, marking, unmarking,
* listing, and deleting tasks. It also handles string formatting for user feedback
* related to the tasks in the list.
* The list that stores all the tasks.
* Constructs a new TaskList with an empty list of tasks.
* Constructs a new TaskList with the specified list of tasks.
* @param taskList The list of tasks to initialize the TaskList with.
* Adds a Todo task to the task list and returns a formatted string confirming the addition.
* @param userInput The description of the Todo task to add.
* @return A formatted string confirming the addition of the task.
* Adds a Deadline task to the task list and returns a formatted string confirming the addition.
* @param userInput The description of the Deadline task to add.
* @return A formatted string confirming the addition of the task.
* Adds an Event task to the task list and returns a formatted string confirming the addition.
* @param userInput The description of the Event task to add.
* @return A formatted string confirming the addition of the task.
* Returns a formatted string representing the list of tasks.
* @return A string listing all tasks in the task list.
* Marks a task as completed by its index in the task list and returns a formatted string confirming the change.
* @param userInput The index of the task to mark as completed (1-based index).
* @return A formatted string confirming that the task has been marked as completed.
* Unmarks a task as completed by its index in the task list and returns a formatted string confirming the change.
* @param userInput The index of the task to unmark (1-based index).

* Deletes a task from the task list by its index and returns a formatted string confirming the deletion.
* @param userInput The index of the task to delete (1-based index).
* @return A formatted string confirming that the task has been deleted.
* Returns a formatted string confirming that a task has been added.
* @param taskDescription The string representation of the task that was added.
* @return A formatted string confirming the addition of the task.
return "Got it. I've added this task:" + '\n' + "    " +
"Now you have " + this.taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.";
* Returns a formatted string confirming that a task has been removed.
